title: Authors and Citation
text: Marcell Granat. Maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Granát M (2023). granatlib: Marcell's Personal R Package. R package version 0.1.0, https://github.com/MarcellGranat/granatlib.
code: @Manual{,   title = {granatlib: Marcell's Personal R Package},   author = {Marcell Granát},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://github.com/MarcellGranat/granatlib}, }

title: Marcell's Personal R Package
text: R package contains functions suitable habits facilitate execution everyday tasks. visited page, probably student colleague, don’t think explanation justified.

title: Marcell's Personal R Package
code: install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("marcellgranat/granatlib")

title: Marcell's Personal R Package
text: functions package ad-hoc developed, everything reference menu

what: Additional formatting options for a broom::tidy() data.frame — cleaned_tidy
title: Additional formatting options for a broom::tidy() data.frame — cleaned_tidy
text: Additional formatting options broom::tidy() data.frame

title: Additional formatting options for a broom::tidy() data.frame — cleaned_tidy
code: cleaned_tidy(x, hun = FALSE)

title: Additional formatting options for a broom::tidy() data.frame — cleaned_tidy
text: x model tidied data.frame hun Hungarian output? (default FALSE)

title: Additional formatting options for a broom::tidy() data.frame — cleaned_tidy
code: m <- broom::tidy(lm(Sepal.Length ~ Petal.Width, iris)) cleaned_tidy(m) #> Error in case_when(x$p.value < 0.01 ~ "***", x$p.value < 0.05 ~ "**",     x$p.value < 0.1 ~ "*", TRUE ~ ""): could not find function "case_when"  m <- lm(Sepal.Length ~ Petal.Width, iris) cleaned_tidy(m, hun = TRUE) #> Error in cleaned_tidy(m, hun = TRUE): x is not an lm object or a tidied data.frame

title: colorised_datatable — colorised_datatable
text: Colorise  draw column numeric selected columns (chr vector) data.frame

title: colorised_datatable — colorised_datatable
code: colorised_datatable(.data, .cols = NULL, type = "bg-color", ...)

title: colorised_datatable — colorised_datatable
text: .data data.frame. .cols Columns colorise (default numrical columns). type "bar" "bg-color" (default).

title: Create progress bar. — create_pb
text: Create progress bar.

title: Create progress bar. — create_pb
code: create_pb(x, .message = TRUE)

title: Create a secret pin — create_pin
text: Create secret pin

title: Create a secret pin — create_pin
code: create_pin(onedrive_folder = NULL)

title: Create a secret pin — create_pin
text: onedrive_folder Name folder use

title: depedency_check — depedency_check
text: Check dependencies function compare import field. Also possible rewrite code explicit function calls.

title: depedency_check — depedency_check
code: depedency_check(file_name)

title: dummify — dummify
text: Dummify non-numeric dplyr::selected columns (chr vector) data.frame

title: dummify — dummify
code: dummify(.data, .col = NULL, sep = "_")

title: dummify — dummify
code: dummify(ggplot2::diamonds, "cut") #> # A tibble: 53,940 × 14 #>    carat color clarity depth table price     x     y     z cut_Ideal cut_Premium #>    <dbl> <ord> <ord>   <dbl> <dbl> <int> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>     <dbl>       <dbl> #>  1  0.23 E     SI2      61.5    55   326  3.95  3.98  2.43         1           0 #>  2  0.21 E     SI1      59.8    61   326  3.89  3.84  2.31         0           1 #>  3  0.23 E     VS1      56.9    65   327  4.05  4.07  2.31         0           0 #>  4  0.29 I     VS2      62.4    58   334  4.2   4.23  2.63         0           1 #>  5  0.31 J     SI2      63.3    58   335  4.34  4.35  2.75         0           0 #>  6  0.24 J     VVS2     62.8    57   336  3.94  3.96  2.48         0           0 #>  7  0.24 I     VVS1     62.3    57   336  3.95  3.98  2.47         0           0 #>  8  0.26 H     SI1      61.9    55   337  4.07  4.11  2.53         0           0 #>  9  0.22 E     VS2      65.1    61   337  3.87  3.78  2.49         0           0 #> 10  0.23 H     VS1      59.4    61   338  4     4.05  2.39         0           0 #> # … with 53,930 more rows, and 3 more variables: cut_Good <dbl>, #> #   `cut_Very Good` <dbl>, cut_Fair <dbl>  dummify(ggplot2::diamonds) #> # A tibble: 53,940 × 27 #>    carat cut_I…¹ cut_P…² cut_G…³ cut_V…⁴ cut_F…⁵ color_E color_I color_J color_H #>    <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl> #>  1  0.23       1       0       0       0       0       1       0       0       0 #>  2  0.21       0       1       0       0       0       1       0       0       0 #>  3  0.23       0       0       1       0       0       1       0       0       0 #>  4  0.29       0       1       0       0       0       0       1       0       0 #>  5  0.31       0       0       1       0       0       0       0       1       0 #>  6  0.24       0       0       0       1       0       0       0       1       0 #>  7  0.24       0       0       0       1       0       0       1       0       0 #>  8  0.26       0       0       0       1       0       0       0       0       1 #>  9  0.22       0       0       0       0       1       1       0       0       0 #> 10  0.23       0       0       0       1       0       0       0       0       1 #> # title: environment_diff — environment_diff
text: Check difference environment two state function call

title: environment_diff — environment_diff
code: environment_diff()

title: environment_diff — environment_diff
code: d <- 2 e <- 3 environment_diff() rm(d) e <- 5 a <- 3 environment_diff()

title: eu_country_map — eu_country_map
text: Country map.

title: eu_country_map — eu_country_map
code: eu_country_map(x, text_size = 1.5, label_fun = function(x) x)

title: eu_country_map — eu_country_map
code: eurostat::get_eurostat("ei_lmhu_m") |>   group_by(geo) |>   slice_max(time) |>   filter(indic == "LM-UN-M-TOT", s_adj == "SA") |>   select(geo, values) |>   eu_country_map() #> Error in x %>% purrr::set_names("geo", "value") %>% dplyr::right_join(eurostat::get_eurostat_geospatial(nuts_level = 0),     by = "geo") %>% dplyr::mutate(geo = countrycode::countrycode(geo,     "iso2c", "iso3c"), s = as.numeric(sf::st_area(geometry))) %>%     ggplot2::ggplot(): could not find function "%>%"

what: Find publications with dplyr::dplyr::filters based on PorP exported file — find_publication
title: Find publications with dplyr::dplyr::filters based on PorP exported file — find_publication
text: Find publications dplyr::dplyr::filters based [PorP](https://harzing.com/resources/publish--perish) exported file (also sci-mago dplyr::dplyr::filters)

title: Find publications with dplyr::dplyr::filters based on PorP exported file — find_publication
code: find_publication(file, n = NULL, open = FALSE, ...)

title: Find publications with dplyr::dplyr::filters based on PorP exported file — find_publication
text: file csv file n Number articles open Open default browser? FALSE, data.frame returned

title: Find publications with dplyr::dplyr::filters based on PorP exported file — find_publication
code: find_publication("https://gist.githubusercontent.com/MarcellGranat/4ed653c8e655d4ebabaa3071fc7b50a0/raw/5aef770bce91b661744ad8c8b1aed56643f795cf/daily-inflation-online.csv", n = 10, FALSE, year > 2015) #> Error in dplyr::mutate(scimago, Categories = purrr::map(Categories, str_split_1,     ";")): ℹ In argument: `Categories = purrr::map(Categories, str_split_1, ";")`. #> Caused by error in `as_mapper()`: #> ! object 'str_split_1' not found

title: geom_tag — geom_tag
text: highlight datapoint figure label.

title: geom_tag — geom_tag
code: geom_tag(   x,   y,   label = "label",   color = "cyan4",   shape = 16,   nudge_x = -0.5,   nudge_y = -0.5,   point_size = 3,   label_size = 3 )

title: gg_ppt — gg_ppt
text: Copies gg object new powerpoint slide.

title: gg_ppt — gg_ppt
code: gg_ppt(x = .Last.value, filename = "plot")

title: gg_ppt — gg_ppt
text: x gg object (.last.value) filename Name slide. '.pptx' redundant . (plot)

title: gg_ppt — gg_ppt
code: ggplot(cars, aes(speed, dist)) + geom_point() #> Error in ggplot(cars, aes(speed, dist)): could not find function "ggplot" gg_ppt() #> Error in eval_tidy(value$code): object '' not found

title: ggtf_idf — ggtf_idf
text: Draws graph bigrams, contain least one words highest TF-IDF value.

title: ggtf_idf — ggtf_idf
code: ggtf_idf(   x,   stem_function = function(x) corpus::stem_snowball(x, "hu"),   n = 10,   language = "hu",   drop_words = stopwords::stopwords("hu"),   min_bigram_n = 1,   drop_numbers = TRUE )

title: ggtf_idf — ggtf_idf
text: x data.frame containing one fct column one column text. Levels fct column gives categories TF-IDF calculation, first last level appear plot

title: ggtf_idf — ggtf_idf
text: Ggobject overview_print

title: ggtf_idf — ggtf_idf
code: plot3D() #> Warning: 'rgl.triangles' is deprecated. #> Use 'triangles3d' instead. #> See help("Deprecated") #> Warning: 'rgl.viewpoint' is deprecated. #> Use 'view3d' instead. #> See help("Deprecated") #> Warning: 'rgl::rgl.material' is deprecated. #> Use 'material3d' instead. #> See help("Deprecated") #> Warning: 'rgl.triangles' is deprecated. #> Use 'triangles3d' instead. #> See help("Deprecated")

title: hl — hl
text: Manage different behaviour html & kable output. Short name (Html-Latex) markdown inline formatting:  r hl(x, y).

title: hl — hl
code: hl(output_html, output_latex)

title: hl — hl
text: one given outputs based environment

title: Display message. — info

what: Call TryCatch n times with given sleep times. — n_times_try
title: Call TryCatch n times with given sleep times. — n_times_try
text: Mainly suggested web scraping reaching given domain short time leads errors.

title: Call TryCatch n times with given sleep times. — n_times_try
code: n_times_try(   .exp,   sleep_times = c(3, 3, 3),   otherwise = NULL,   print_message = FALSE )

title: Call TryCatch n times with given sleep times. — n_times_try
text: .exp Expression otherwise Value return tries resulted error. print_message print message (default FALSE). sleep_time Numeric vector given seconds wait next try.

title: Call TryCatch n times with given sleep times. — n_times_try
code: v <- list("a", "B", 2) # only 3rd element can be added to another numeric i = 0 n_times_try({ i = i + 1 v[[i]] + 3 }) #> Warning: restarting interrupted promise evaluation #> Warning: restarting interrupted promise evaluation #> [1] 5

title: plot3D — plot3D
text: Plot function 2 input values 3D based ggplot2 & rayshader package.

title: plot3D — plot3D
code: plot3D(   f = function(x, y) x^0.2 * y^0.2,   x.min = 0,   y.min = 0,   x.max = 10,   y.max = 10,   n = 100,   low = "blue",   high = "red",   title = NULL,   legend.title = "f",   xlab = "x",   ylab = "y" )

title: plot3D — plot3D
text: f function, plotted 3D (function(x, y) x^0.2*y^0.2) x.min Lower limit x-axis (0) y.min Lower limit y-axis (0) x.max Upper limit x-axis (10) y.max Upper limit y-axis (10) n Number points rows columns (100) low Colour lowest value ("blue") high Colour highest value ("red") title Title plot (f expression) legend.title Title legend ("f") xlab Title x-axis ("x") ylab Title th y-axis ("y")

title: plot3D — plot3D
text: 3D figure based rayshader. overview_print

title: splitted_mutate — splitted_mutate
text: Splits data.frame separeta parts evaluates one--one. Useful saving memmory large computations.

title: splitted_mutate — splitted_mutate
code: splitted_mutate(.data, ..., split_number = 100, .keep = NULL, .progress = TRUE)

title: splitted_mutate — splitted_mutate
text: .data Data frame. ... arguments pass mutate(...). split_number Number parts split data.frame evaluation. .keep Variables keep eval expression. Original columns keept automaticly. cores Number cores use. cores = 1 (default) evaluation made simple loop.

title: splitted_mutate — splitted_mutate
text: .data overview_print

title: splitted_mutate — splitted_mutate
code: iris_samples <- tibble(data = replicate(100, sample_n(iris, 50), simplify = FALSE)) #> Error in tibble(data = replicate(100, sample_n(iris, 50), simplify = FALSE)): could not find function "tibble"  iris_samples #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'iris_samples' not found  iris_samples %>%  splitted_mutate(    fit = map(data, lm, formula = Sepal.Length ~ Sepal.Width),    coefs = map(fit, "coefficients"),    coef1 = map_dbl(coefs, 1),    coef2 = map_dbl(coefs, 2),    .keep = c("coef1", "coef2") # single core  ) #> Error in iris_samples %>% splitted_mutate(fit = map(data, lm, formula = Sepal.Length ~     Sepal.Width), coefs = map(fit, "coefficients"), coef1 = map_dbl(coefs,     1), coef2 = map_dbl(coefs, 2), .keep = c("coef1", "coef2")): could not find function "%>%"  iris_samples %>%  splitted_mutate(    fit = map(data, lm, formula = Sepal.Length ~ Sepal.Width),    coefs = map(fit, "coefficients"),    coef1 = map_dbl(coefs, 1),    coef2 = map_dbl(coefs, 2),    .keep = c("coef1", "coef2"),    cores = 6 # multicore evaluation  ) #> Error in iris_samples %>% splitted_mutate(fit = map(data, lm, formula = Sepal.Length ~     Sepal.Width), coefs = map(fit, "coefficients"), coef1 = map_dbl(coefs,     1), coef2 = map_dbl(coefs, 2), .keep = c("coef1", "coef2"),     cores = 6): could not find function "%>%"

title: splitted_transmute — splitted_transmute
text: Splits data.frame separeta parts evaluates one--one. Useful saving memmory large computations.

title: splitted_transmute — splitted_transmute
code: splitted_transmute(   .data,   ...,   split_number = 100,   .keep = NULL,   .progress = TRUE )

title: splitted_transmute — splitted_transmute
text: .data Data frame. ... arguments pass transmute(...). split_number Number parts split data.frame evaluation. .keep Variables keep eval expression. newly created columns keept automaticly.

title: splitted_transmute — splitted_transmute
code: iris_samples <- tibble(data = replicate(100, sample_n(iris, 50), simplify = FALSE)) #> Error in tibble(data = replicate(100, sample_n(iris, 50), simplify = FALSE)): could not find function "tibble"  iris_samples #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'iris_samples' not found  iris_samples %>%  splitted_transmute(    fit = map(data, lm, formula = Sepal.Length ~ Sepal.Width),    coefs = map(fit, "coefficients"),    coef1 = map_dbl(coefs, 1),    coef2 = map_dbl(coefs, 2),    .keep = c("coef1", "coef2") # single core  ) #> Error in iris_samples %>% splitted_transmute(fit = map(data, lm, formula = Sepal.Length ~     Sepal.Width), coefs = map(fit, "coefficients"), coef1 = map_dbl(coefs,     1), coef2 = map_dbl(coefs, 2), .keep = c("coef1", "coef2")): could not find function "%>%"

title: tot_summarise — tot_summarise

title: tot_summarise — tot_summarise
code: tot_summarise(x, ..., total_name = "Total")

title: tot_summarise — tot_summarise
text: x grouped data.frame ... Arguments pass summarise(...) total_name Label total row. default "Total"

title: tot_summarise — tot_summarise
text: grouped data.frame overview_print

title: tot_summarise — tot_summarise
code: iris |>  dplyr::group_by(Species) |>  tot_summarise(mean(Sepal.Length)) #> # A tibble: 4 × 2 #> # Groups:   Species [4] #>   Species    `mean(Sepal.Length)` #>   <fct>                     <dbl> #> 1 virginica                  6.59 #> 2 versicolor                 5.94 #> 3 setosa                     5.01 #> 4 Total                      5.84
